newsitem.title: USA: Sync Research sees Q1 loss of $6 mln.
newsitem.headline: Sync Research sees Q1 loss of $6 mln.

text.p: Sync Research Inc said Thursday it expects to report a net loss of about $6.0 million, including restructuring charges, for its first fiscal quarter, ending March 31.
The company said in a statement it expects revenues for the quarter will be about $5.6 million.
The company said operating results would be below analysts' expectations. Analysts had expected the company would post a loss of $0.11 a share for its first quarter, according to First Call.
Sync also said it will make significant expense reductions over the next two weeks aimed at allowing it to achieve profitability at lower revenues.

"We encountered several issues which had a negative impact on our numbers and are in the process of developing a response," said president Roger Dorf. "We are confident that over the long term we can successfully address the growth in this market place."
The company said that, despite the weak results it is seeing an expansion of the customer prospects who are actively considering the purchase of Sync products.
